storyInfo: Before the Regent and Confessarius, Hoederer is horrified to discover that the Regent had orchestrated everything. He and his messengers must find a way to warn W.

attributes.content: I have seen your report.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Your achievements with Reunion are, to say the least, not worthy of commendation.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: However, that being said, you have indeed procured some unexpectedly useful information.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Thank——
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No, there is no need for thanks. At least, not this time.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: You are all impressive warriors, and until your deaths, you are entitled to the rewards you've earned by virtue of the blood, sweat, and tears you have shed.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: His Majesty the Regent knows well the acts and deeds of all Sarkaz, even those as insignificant as yourself.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: The Infected are not the only thing in this temple gradually depreciating. Do you understand?
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: ...I do.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: If I am correct in my predictions, Rhodes Island has already welcomed the return of a certain unpalatable individual.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: And you... you should have made contact.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: (The Regent is even faster than W? All the way from Londinium?!)
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mercenaries know loyalty only to their own interests. But that nonetheless makes a fine starting point.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: When the dust settles, and you stand once again before the throne of His Majesty——
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: That is when you will receive your reward.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: And what about the other warriors?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The young Infected has her own plans. Were you unaware?
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: But His Majesty will not participate in such nonsense. We have mutually decided that Victoria will stand by and watch Reunion's next move.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: We lack 'effective measures' to retake control of that unit from W.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Furthermore, it is important that we, in the name of our supporters, continue to whip up the Infected in all corners of the world.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: We're still going to use Reunion? I was sure His Majesty would have...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Given up? Oh my no, young mercenary.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Things are yet far from chaotic enough. Even if Reunion has strayed from its leadership, it remains a source of chaos——
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: What's more, should your words just now be taken as a question of His Majesty's intentions?
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: No, absolutely not.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Very well. Raise your head...
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Oh, yes.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: For the time being, you need not return to Kazdel. The journey back is too long, and matters have been progressing rapidly there.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: You are to stay here, for now. Enjoy this small respite however you can.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Thank you very much.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Now then, His Majesty awaits me. You are dismissed.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Remember, see to your own business first, Hoederer.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hoederer, yes?
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: I look forward to seeing what else you uncover.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: ...*Sigh*.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Looks like it's house arrest for both of us?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: It's not like I never thought about it. And hey, it's better than I was expecting...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But we were a little too naive.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Which part was naive? The part where you thought you'd die, or the part where you thought the Regent didn't know?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Both. He's been pulling the strings from the start.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Not that I'm surprised... he's Theresis. We've all heard the stories about him and Theresa, the invincible forces of nature...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But I guess in the course of the war, I forgot those stories... weren't just stories.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So how do we warn W? What's going on with Reunion?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: We wasted so much time on the road. She might've already split with Talulah.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: The other possibility is the show ends in Lungmen.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Wouldn't that be a bit too quick?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: It fits with the way W works. If Talulah's gonna destroy the Infected, W'll destroy Talulah first.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sarkaz style. With extreme prejudice.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: She's pretty upset over the death of a certain merc, after all.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: She knows the score.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: She's out of room to hesitate any longer. Now she just needs to get into the right headspace to make a move.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And that means we're left waiting.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: We've got ways to fool the Regent's eyes. It'd be a crazy risky play, but...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I've still got my own squad I can keep on 'standby.'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Victoria's all over the place right now. They probably wouldn't catch the code.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Yeah, and it would have to pass by some real tricky spots controlled by the Regent... and on to Kazdel.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Kazdel?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: The battlefield ruins there haven't been touched in a long time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But we eked out a living there for a good long time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: There was a communications station in an old bunker buried under those ruins. The tower made it look like it was destroyed, but everything down there still works.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hold on, that was a long time ago...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: How long have you been preparing this?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: All done way back at the very beginning. Cost me a pretty penny too.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Heh heh.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Oh man... if they saw the look on your face right now, boy would they be surprised.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: For a while now, every time you came back from a battle, you were always deep in thought, like a kid who did something bad.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: I figured you'd just lost your will to fight.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Nah, it was the opposite, actually. I finally realized what it was I had to do.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: How?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Because I had no choice. It's kind of liberating, in a way?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: W must've said something to you before you left Chernobog.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Does that sound like her? Laying all the cards on the table?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No. She'd be a lot less of a pain if she did though.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: You're right that she came looking for me before I left the core city. She knew what we were going to do.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: She...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Can you put a price on the life of a merc?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Sure. Always have. Why even ask? You knew the answer.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But who set the price?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The war itself.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sure... you got your battlefield honors, your victories, the glory you pull out of a hand-to-hand fight, all the things that raise your profile, that let everybody know what a useful tool you are.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: So boring.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But that's all in the past. At least for us it is.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...What do you mean?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Every Sarkaz merc should have a nice, clean price tag.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But we don't need anybody to slap it on. No oversight. They write their own price in the blood of the enemies of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You... are you saying we should get everyone to leave Kazdel...?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You look surprised. But like, they could choose for themselves.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Does this sound weird?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Not weird, right?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Just give it some thought... think about what you could be doing in Kazdel.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You're talking about doing that right in front of Theresis, in broad daylight.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You make it sound so bad. As if you don't have your own plans.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Chill... you were my boss, Hoederer.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You'd better do it, or we'll have trouble.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That's a pretty good joke. The old hands at the Scar Market would laugh themselves into a coma.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: It certainly wouldn't make the committee happy. They'd be out a lotta money, and a lotta wasted brainpower.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Not to mention all the people they killed.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Sure enough... and the old hands there too... some of them are almost friends of ours...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So what are you gonna do now? It's up to you.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Well... I can't leave Londinium. Hell, I can't even leave this mansion.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I think it's up to you.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You can do a lot as a 'Messenger.'
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: 'Keep following Talulah's orders. Hoederer isn't coming back yet.' Should be good?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: As long as that comms station still works, we'll hear back. And they'll get word to W.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: I know how to do this.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: Don't give me orders.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Messenger

attributes.content: *Sigh*... What a pain in the ass...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Just when I decide to go after the dragon lady... What a time you picked.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Get out here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The ruins of Chernobog weren't like those of Kazdel.
There were still traces of life out on the streets, ravaged as they were. They gave you some idea of what had been.
Unlike the total annihilation back there.
Like, for example...
Those two kids. Kids painstakingly raising their weapons.
Devil! What are you doing here?!
attributes.name: Unyielding Child

attributes.content: N-no, don't provoke her...
attributes.name: Waifish Child

attributes.content: S-sorry... we were just leaving...
attributes.name: Waifish Child

attributes.content: Hey—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That's an army sword you're holding, isn't it?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Yes, it is. Sarkaz steel... You can't even lift it. Why are you hauling that thing around?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You gonna fight back? You gonna kill me?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Eeep——
attributes.name: Waifish Child

attributes.content: G-get back——agh!
attributes.name: Unyielding Child

attributes.content: Rublev... your leg!
attributes.name: Waifish Child

attributes.content: Oh, you're hurt.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You're gonna get infected. This city got hit with a Catastrophe. It's not safe here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I won't turn into a thing like you!
attributes.name: Unyielding Child

attributes.content: Aww. What a tough kid.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Let me ask you——
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ——Do you know what it means to take up the blade of a fallen Sarkaz?
attributes.name: W
